title: Who is your favorite champion?
body:
I mean lore wise.

My favorite is Ryze. He has been through countless tragics, and he understands that sacrifice must be made...
_____________________
“There are many children among us. And three of our women are swollen with child. You would doom us all?” asked Yago desperately.

“How many are in this village?” asked Ryze.

“Ninety-two” replied Yago.

“And how many are in the world?”
___________________
[An Old Friend](https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/ryze-color-story/)

{{champion:91}} Because he is loyal to who he serves. To who he respects. He is not a traitor, not a man that leaves his job half done. He has no hand in dirty schemes, he just does what he does best. I wish I could write more but he is still outdated {{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}}

{{champion:134}} 

It's just a coincidence tbh. Well, not really, but here's the thing: I like powerful characters, no matter in which story. What made me like Syndra with her first lore, is how she used her powers. She wanted to use it for herself, because she just liked it. I'm not fan of the "I must use my power for the greater good without ever thinking about me" cliché.
All she ever wanted (in her old lore), was to break her own barriers, to push away her limits (she was not "power hungry" as people used to imagine. She wasn't looking to take power from the land, like Zed for example, she just wanted to explore her own potential). 
Now, in her new lore, things are a bit different, but she still is this enormous powerhouse, that is naturally powerful. She's always been bullied and lied to, and now that she's finally free, she's ready to take her destiny into her own hands.
Plus I really like her in The Dreaming Pool. Can't wait for her to get an actual color story :O!

"My potential is limitless. I will not be restrained."

Yeah Syndra is a good one. She is often mistaken, but in reality she just wanted a bit more control over things.

I heard The Dreaming Pool is really good. I'll read it soon.

I'm really looking forward to Ezreal's future developments after his update; he has a good chance of becoming my favorite lore-wise.

For now though, I have a ton of Champions that I barely play but enjoy story-wise or personality-wise. Swain, Lux, Taliyah, Miss Fortune, a good chunk of Ionians and Freljordians. Mordekaiser probably tops this list, an expansionist with such incredible ambition that he continues his empire beyond death is pretty...well, pretty metal, and I love the repercussions his story has on both modern-day Noxus and the Shadow Isles. I look forward to see how they develop Morde's lore with his upcoming VGU.

Yeah Ezeral actually makes up a big part of the world building of Runeterra.

If you haven't checked out the [Map of Runeterra](https://map.leagueoflegends.com/en_US), I highly suggest you to look deep into it. Ez's journal is all over the known part of Runeterra, and I wouldn't be surprised if Riot decides to use Ez's journal as a way to introduce new parts of Runeterra.

Mordekaiser is... not my favorite. He is quite ambitious, and I'm more into characters who do big things without creating a scene (Ryze was famous because he is a powerful mage and has been collecting the World Runes for centuries).
{{champion:20}} flawless

{{champion:101}} 

A champion built on ironies. 

All things he dared to do were for freedom, directly and indirectly, changed him to what he loathed for his entire life. Sparkles fueled by hatred, burned his humanity away. He became what he would destroy. A tyrant over everyone, but even worse than what he ever met.

He dreamed freedom, so he obliterated his still loving best friend in that regard. He made it sure Shurima would collapse, so he could get free.

Sadly (more like fortunately), he is less free than ever. Sarcophagus and Tomb of the Emperors, 2 imprisoments in a row made him even more lost.

Ambition, hatred, loneliness, power, isolation consumed him entirely. He is insane. He needs help desperately. In his deep soul, he probably knows that.

{{champion:75}} and {{champion:39}} are hands down my favourite champions in the game, {{champion:23}} is problably my 3rd favourite, praying he gets a new model soon.

Syndra... tho her recent lore update really messed with her characterization... something I Hope Riot addresses.   The aspect of her training them subsequent betrayal is the point in particular.   Originally, Syndra was growing into her power and revelling in her constant growth, then the Elder who was supposed to be fostering her was revealed to actually be hampering her,  then he threatens to remove her powers in totality... so she lashes out.    From this original story, it was surmised that syndra has been bullied as a child and that there was a possibility that the Elders weren’t as benevolent as Ionians would think... whether that be due to needing to sap her power to fuel theirs for the war, being jealous of her powers or jsut being scared.        
I think there were a few changes since the update, but even now there’s still an element of justification missing that gave Syndra some more understability.   The Elder didn’t threaten her but instead tried to console her....   keeping the”theeatene To remove her power” aspect is what made her outrage sympathetic.


Other than that, the Dreaming Pool story was quite a damn good story haha.       Tho my personal favorite color story is The Eye of the Abyss,   So much tension, for me it was the first glimpse as to why the Void is such an important storyline, yes it was always an important and relevant plot line, but that color story cemented and sparked the “oh shit” factor.... and that was before we saw the first Voidspawn.
